rows.arabic: الٓمٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Alif, Lam, Mim, Ra. These are the signs of the Book. That which has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth, but most people do not believe [in it].
rows.transliteration: alif lām mīm rā ۚ tilka āyātul kitāb ۗ wal ladhī unzila ilayka min rabbikal ḥaqqu walākinna aktharan nāsi lā yu-minūn

bismillah.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى رَفَعَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِى لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ يُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقَآءِ رَبِّكُمْ تُوقِنُونَ
rows.translation: It is Allah who raised the heavens without any pillars that you see, and then presided over the Throne. He disposed the sun and the moon, each moving for a specified term. He directs the command, [and] elaborates the signs that you may be certain of encountering your Lord.
rows.transliteration: allāhul ladhī rafa`as samāwāti bighayri `amadin tarawnahā ۖ thummas-tawā `alal-`arsh ۖ wasakhharash shamsa wal qamar ۖ kullun yajrī li-ajalin musammā ۚ yudabbirul-amra yufaṣṣilul-āyāti la`allakum biliqā-i rabbikum tūqinūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَدَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنْهَـٰرًا ۖ وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ جَعَلَ فِيهَا زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ ۖ يُغْشِى ٱلَّيْلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: It is He who has spread out the earth and set in it firm mountains and streams, and of every fruit in it He has made two kinds. He draws the night’s cover over the day. There are indeed signs in that for a people who reflect.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī maddal-arḍa waja`ala fīhā rawāsiya wa-anhārā ۖ wa min kullith thamarāti ja`ala fīhā zawjaynith-nayn ۖ yughshil laylan nahār ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yatafakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ قِطَعٌ مُّتَجَـٰوِرَٰتٌ وَجَنَّـٰتٌ مِّنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍ وَزَرْعٌ وَنَخِيلٌ صِنْوَانٌ وَغَيْرُ صِنْوَانٍ يُسْقَىٰ بِمَآءٍ وَٰحِدٍ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعْضَهَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فِى ٱلْأُكُلِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: In the earth are neighbouring terrains [of diverse kinds] and vineyards, farms, and date palms growing from the same root and from diverse roots, [all] irrigated by the same water, and We give some of them an advantage over others in flavour. There are indeed signs in that for people who exercise their reason.
rows.transliteration: wafil-arḍi qiṭa`un mutajāwirātun wajannātun min a`nābin wazar`un wanakhīlun ṣinwānun waghayru ṣinwāniy yusqā bimā-in wāḥidin wanufaḍḍilu ba`ḍahā `alā ba`ḍin fil-ukul ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَإِن تَعْجَبْ فَعَجَبٌ قَوْلُهُمْ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًا أَءِنَّا لَفِى خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلْأَغْلَـٰلُ فِىٓ أَعْنَاقِهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: If you are to wonder [at anything], then wonderful is their remark, ‘When we have become dust, shall we be [ushered] into a new creation?’ They are the ones who defy their Lord; they shall have iron collars around their necks, they shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, and they shall remain in it [forever].
rows.transliteration: wa in ta`jab fa`ajabun qawluhum a-idhā kunnā turāban a-innā lafī khalqin jadīd ۗ ulā-ikal ladhīna kafarū birabbihim ۖ wa-ulā-ikal-aghlālu fī a`nāqihim ۖ wa-ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِمُ ٱلْمَثُلَـٰتُ ۗ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو مَغْفِرَةٍ لِّلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ ظُلْمِهِمْ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَشَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: They would press you for evil sooner than for good, though there have already gone by before them exemplary punishments. Indeed your Lord is forgiving to mankind despite their wrongdoing, and indeed your Lord is severe in retribution.
rows.transliteration: wayasta`jilūnaka bis sayyi-ati qablal-ḥasanati waqad khalat min qablihimul mathulāt ۗ wa inna rabbaka ladhū maghfiratin linnāsi `alā ẓul-mihim ۖ wa inna rabbaka lashadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَلِكُلِّ قَوْمٍ هَادٍ
rows.translation: The faithless say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ You are only a warner, and there is a guide for every people.
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lawlā unzila `alayhi āyatun min rabbih ۗ innamā anta mundhir ۖ walikulli qawmin hād

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَحْمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثَىٰ وَمَا تَغِيضُ ٱلْأَرْحَامُ وَمَا تَزْدَادُ ۖ وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ عِندَهُۥ بِمِقْدَارٍ
rows.translation: Allah knows what every female carries [in her womb], and what the wombs reduce and what they increase, and everything is by [precise] measure with Him,
rows.transliteration: allāhu ya`lamu mā taḥmilu kullu unthā wa mā taghīḍul-arḥāmu wa mā tazdād ۖ wakullu shay-in `indahu bimiqdār

rows.arabic: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ ٱلْكَبِيرُ ٱلْمُتَعَالِ
rows.translation: the Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, the All-great, the All-sublime.
rows.transliteration: `ālimul ghaybi wash shahādatil kabīrul muta`āl

rows.arabic: سَوَآءٌ مِّنكُم مَّنْ أَسَرَّ ٱلْقَوْلَ وَمَن جَهَرَ بِهِۦ وَمَنْ هُوَ مُسْتَخْفٍۭ بِٱلَّيْلِ وَسَارِبٌۢ بِٱلنَّهَارِ
rows.translation: It is the same [to Him] whether any of you speaks secretly, or does so loudly, or whether he lurks in the night, or is open to view in daytime.
rows.transliteration: sawā-un minkum man asarral qawla wa man jahara bihi wa man huwa mustakhfin bil layli wasāribun bin nahār

rows.arabic: لَهُۥ مُعَقِّبَـٰتٌ مِّنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ يَحْفَظُونَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُغَيِّرُ مَا بِقَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا۟ مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ ۗ وَإِذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِقَوْمٍ سُوٓءًا فَلَا مَرَدَّ لَهُۥ ۚ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَالٍ
rows.translation: He has guardian angels, to his front and his rear, who guard him by Allah’s command. Indeed Allah does not change a people’s lot, unless they change what is in their souls. And when Allah wishes to visit ill on a people, there is nothing that can avert it, and they have no protector besides Him.
rows.transliteration: lahu mu`aqqibātun min bayni yadayhi wa min khalfihi yaḥfaẓūnahu min amrillāh ۗ innallāha lā yughayyiru mā biqawmin ḥattā yughayyirū mā bi-anfusihim ۗ wa idhā arādallāhu biqawmin sū-an falā maradda lah ۚ wa mā lahum min dūnihi min wāl

rows.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُرِيكُمُ ٱلْبَرْقَ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنشِئُ ٱلسَّحَابَ ٱلثِّقَالَ
rows.translation: It is He who shows you the lightning, inspiring fear and hope, and He produces the clouds heavy [with rain].
rows.transliteration: huwal ladhī yurīkumul barqa khawfan waṭama`an wayunshi-us saḥābath thiqāl

rows.arabic: وَيُسَبِّحُ ٱلرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِۦ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ مِنْ خِيفَتِهِۦ وَيُرْسِلُ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقَ فَيُصِيبُ بِهَا مَن يَشَآءُ وَهُمْ يُجَـٰدِلُونَ فِى ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْمِحَالِ
rows.translation: The Thunder celebrates His praise, and the angels [too], in awe of Him, and He releases the thunderbolts and strikes with them whomever He wishes. Yet they dispute concerning Allah, though He is great in might.
rows.transliteration: wayusabbiḥur ra`du biḥamdihi wal malā-ikatu min khīfatihi wayursiluṣ ṣawā`iqa fayuṣību bihā man yashā-u wahum yujādilūna fillāhi wahuwa shadīdul miḥāl

rows.arabic: لَهُۥ دَعْوَةُ ٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ لَا يَسْتَجِيبُونَ لَهُم بِشَىْءٍ إِلَّا كَبَـٰسِطِ كَفَّيْهِ إِلَى ٱلْمَآءِ لِيَبْلُغَ فَاهُ وَمَا هُوَ بِبَـٰلِغِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا دُعَآءُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ
rows.translation: [Only] to Him belongs the true invocation; and those whom they invoke besides Him do not answer them in any wise—like someone who stretches his hands towards water [desiring] that it should reach his mouth, but it does not reach it—and the invocations of the faithless only go awry.
rows.transliteration: lahu da`watul ḥaqq ۖ wal ladhīna yad`ūna min dūnihi lā yastajībūna lahum bishay-in illā kabāsiṭi kaffayhi ilal-mā-i liyablugha fāhu wa mā huwa bibālighih ۚ wa mā du`ā-ul kāfirīna illā fī ḍalāl

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَظِلَـٰلُهُم بِٱلْغُدُوِّ وَٱلْـَٔاصَالِ ۩
rows.translation: To Allah prostrates whoever there is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and their shadows at sunrise and sunset.
rows.transliteration: walillāhi yasjudu man fis samāwāti wal-arḍi ṭaw`an wakarhan waẓilāluhum bil ghuduwwi wal-āṣāl ۩

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلْ أَفَٱتَّخَذْتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ نَفْعًا وَلَا ضَرًّا ۚ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْبَصِيرُ أَمْ هَلْ تَسْتَوِى ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتُ وَٱلنُّورُ ۗ أَمْ جَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ خَلَقُوا۟ كَخَلْقِهِۦ فَتَشَـٰبَهَ ٱلْخَلْقُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ خَـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَهُوَ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّـٰرُ
rows.translation: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?’ Say, ‘Allah!’ Say, ‘Have you then taken others besides Him for guardians, who have no control over their own benefit or harm?’ Say, ‘Are the blind one and the seer equal? Are darkness and light equal?’ Have they set up for Allah partners who have created like His creation, so that the creations seemed confusable to them? Say, ‘Allah is the creator of all things, and He is the One and the All-paramount.’
rows.transliteration: qul man rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi qulillāh ۚ qul afattakhadhtum min dūnihi awliyā-a lā yamlikūna li-anfusihim naf`an walā ḍarrā ۚ qul hal yastawil-a`mā wal baṣīru am hal tastawiẓ ẓulumātu wan nūr ۗ am ja`alū lillāhi shurakā-a khalaqū kakhalqihi fatashābahal khalqu `alayhim ۚ qulillāhu khāliqu kulli shay-in wahuwal wāḥidul qahhār

rows.arabic: أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَسَالَتْ أَوْدِيَةٌۢ بِقَدَرِهَا فَٱحْتَمَلَ ٱلسَّيْلُ زَبَدًا رَّابِيًا ۚ وَمِمَّا يُوقِدُونَ عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلنَّارِ ٱبْتِغَآءَ حِلْيَةٍ أَوْ مَتَـٰعٍ زَبَدٌ مِّثْلُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحَقَّ وَٱلْبَـٰطِلَ ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلزَّبَدُ فَيَذْهَبُ جُفَآءً ۖ وَأَمَّا مَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ فَيَمْكُثُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ
rows.translation: He sends down water from the sky whereat the valleys are flooded to [the extent of] their capacity, and the flood carries along a swelling scum. And from what they smelt in the fire for the purpose of [making] ornaments or wares, [there arises] a similar scum. That is how Allah compares truth and falsehood. As for the scum, it leaves as dross, and that which profits the people stays in the earth. That is how Allah draws comparisons.
rows.transliteration: anzala minas samā-i mā-an fasālat awdiyatun biqadarihā faḥtamalas saylu zabadan rābiyā ۚ wa mimmā yūqidūna `alayhi fin nārib-tighā-a ḥilyatin aw matā`in zabadun mithluh ۚ kadhālika yaḍribullāhul ḥaqqa wal bāṭil ۚ fa-ammaz zabadu fayadh-habu jufā-ā ۖ wa-ammā mā yanfa`un nāsa fayamkuthu fil-arḍ ۚ kadhālika yaḍribullāhul-amthāl

rows.arabic: لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَجَابُوا۟ لِرَبِّهِمُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُۥ لَوْ أَنَّ لَهُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا وَمِثْلَهُۥ مَعَهُۥ لَٱفْتَدَوْا۟ بِهِۦٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْحِسَابِ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
rows.translation: For those who answer [the summons of] their Lord there shall be the best [of rewards]. But those who do not answer Him, even if they possessed all that is on the earth and as much of it besides, they would surely offer it to redeem themselves with it. For such there shall be an adverse reckoning, and their refuge shall be hell, and it is an evil resting place.
rows.transliteration: lilladhīnas-tajābū lirabbihimul ḥusnā ۚ wal ladhīna lam yastajībū lahu law anna lahum mā fil-arḍi jamī`an wa mithlahu ma`ahu laftadaw bih ۚ ulā-ika lahum sū-ul ḥisābi wa ma-wāhum jahannam ۖ wabi-sal mihād

rows.arabic: أَفَمَن يَعْلَمُ أَنَّمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلْحَقُّ كَمَنْ هُوَ أَعْمَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
rows.translation: Is someone who knows that what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth, like someone who is blind? Only those who possess intellect take admonition
rows.transliteration: afaman ya`lamu annamā unzila ilayka min rabbikal ḥaqqu kaman huwa a`mā ۚ innamā yatadhakkaru ulul-albāb

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُوفُونَ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا يَنقُضُونَ ٱلْمِيثَـٰقَ
rows.translation: —those who fulfill Allah’s covenant and do not break the pledge solemnly made,
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yūfūna bi`ahdillāhi walā yanquḍūnal mīthāq

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَصِلُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ وَيَخَافُونَ سُوٓءَ ٱلْحِسَابِ
rows.translation: and those who join what Allah has commanded to be joined, and fear their Lord, and are afraid of an adverse reckoning
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yaṣilūna mā amarallāhu bihi an yūṣala wayakhshawna rabbahum wayakhāfūna sū al ḥisāb

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
rows.translation: —those who are patient for the sake of their Lord’s pleasure, maintain the prayer, and spend secretly and openly out of what We have provided them, and repel evil [conduct] with good. For such will be the reward of the [ultimate] abode:
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna ṣabarub-tighā-a wajhi rabbihim wa-aqāmuṣ ṣalāta wa-anfaqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa`alāniyatan wayadra-ūna bil ḥasanatis sayyi-ata ulā-ika lahum `uqbad dār

rows.arabic: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ ءَابَآئِهِمْ وَأَزْوَٰجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِهِمْ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَدْخُلُونَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن كُلِّ بَابٍ
rows.translation: the Gardens of Eden, which they will enter along with whoever is righteous from among their forebears, their spouses, and their descendants, and the angels will call on them from every door:
rows.transliteration: jannātu `adniy yadkhulūnahā wa man ṣalaḥa min ābā-ihim wa-azwājihim wadhurriyyātihim ۖ wal malā-ikatu yadkhulūna `alayhim min kulli bāb

rows.arabic: سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُم بِمَا صَبَرْتُمْ ۚ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
rows.translation: ‘Peace be to you, for your patience.’ How excellent is the reward of the [ultimate] abode!
rows.transliteration: salāmun `alaykum bimā ṣabartum ۚ fani`ma `uqbad dār

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مِيثَـٰقِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱللَّعْنَةُ وَلَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلدَّارِ
rows.translation: But as for those who break Allah’s compact after having pledged it solemnly, and sever what Allah has commanded to be joined, and cause corruption in the earth—it is such on whom the curse will lie, and for them will be the ills of the [ultimate] abode.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yanquḍūna `ahdallāhi min ba`di mīthāqihi wayaqṭa`ūna mā amarallāhu bihi an yūṣala wayufsidūna fil-arḍi ulā-ika lahumulla`natu walahum sū-ud dār

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ وَفَرِحُوا۟ بِٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا مَتَـٰعٌ
rows.translation: Allah expands the provision for whomever He wishes, and tightens it. They boast of the life of this world, but compared with the Hereafter the life of this world is but a [trifling] enjoyment.
rows.transliteration: allāhu yabsuṭur rizqa liman yashā-u wayaqdir ۚ wafariḥū bil ḥayātid dunyā wa mal ḥayātud dunyā fil-ākhirati illā matā`

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِىٓ إِلَيْهِ مَنْ أَنَابَ
rows.translation: The faithless say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ Say, ‘Indeed Allah leads astray whomever He wishes, and guides to Himself those who turn penitently [to Him]
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lawlā unzila `alayhi āyatun min rabbih ۗ qul innallāha yuḍillu man yashā-u wayahdī ilayhi man anāb

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَطْمَئِنُّ قُلُوبُهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
rows.translation: —those who have faith and whose hearts find rest in the remembrance of Allah.’ Behold! The hearts find rest in Allah’s remembrance!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna āmanū wataṭma-innu qulūbuhum bidhikrillāh ۗ alā bidhikrillāhi taṭma-innul qulūb

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ طُوبَىٰ لَهُمْ وَحُسْنُ مَـَٔابٍ
rows.translation: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds—happy are they and good is their [ultimate] destination.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti ṭūbā lahum waḥusnu ma-āb

rows.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ فِىٓ أُمَّةٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهَآ أُمَمٌ لِّتَتْلُوَا۟ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ وَهُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ قُلْ هُوَ رَبِّى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ مَتَابِ
rows.translation: Thus have We sent you to a nation before which many nations have passed away, that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you. Yet they defy the All-beneficent. Say, ‘He is my Lord; there is no god except Him; in Him I have put my trust, and to Him will be my return.’
rows.transliteration: kadhālika arsalnāka fī ummatin qad khalat min qablihā umamul litatluwa `alayhimul ladhī awḥaynā ilayka wahum yakfurūna bir raḥmān ۚ qul huwa rabbī lā ilāha illā huwa `alayhi tawakkaltu wa ilayhi matāb

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ قُرْءَانًا سُيِّرَتْ بِهِ ٱلْجِبَالُ أَوْ قُطِّعَتْ بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضُ أَوْ كُلِّمَ بِهِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ ۗ بَل لِّلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْرُ جَمِيعًا ۗ أَفَلَمْ يَا۟يْـَٔسِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَن لَّوْ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ لَهَدَى ٱلنَّاسَ جَمِيعًا ۗ وَلَا يَزَالُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ تُصِيبُهُم بِمَا صَنَعُوا۟ قَارِعَةٌ أَوْ تَحُلُّ قَرِيبًا مِّن دَارِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِىَ وَعْدُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
rows.translation: If only it were a Quran whereby the mountains could be moved, or the earth could be toured, or the dead could be spoken to.... Indeed, all dispensation belongs to Allah. Have not the faithful yet realised that had Allah wished He would have guided mankind all together? The faithless will continue to be visited by catastrophes because of their doings—or they will land near their habitations—until Allah’s promise comes to pass. Indeed Allah does not break His promise.
rows.transliteration: walaw anna qur-ānan suyyirat bihil jibālu aw quṭṭi`at bihil-arḍu aw kullima bihil mawtā ۗ bal lillāhil-amru jamī`ā ۗ afalam yay-asil ladhīna āmanū an law yashā-ullāhu lahadan nāsa jamī`ā ۗ walā yazālul ladhīna kafarū tuṣībuhum bimā ṣana`ū qāri`atun aw taḥullu qarīban min dārihim ḥattā ya-tiya wa`dullāh ۚ innallāha lā yukhliful mī`ād

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدِ ٱسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَأَمْلَيْتُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عِقَابِ
rows.translation: Apostles were certainly derided before you. But then I gave respite to those who were faithless, then I seized them; so how was My retribution?
rows.transliteration: walaqadis-tuhzi-a birusulin min qablika fa-amlaytu lilladhīna kafarū thumma akhadhtuhum ۖ fakayfa kāna `iqāb

rows.arabic: أَفَمَنْ هُوَ قَآئِمٌ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ ۗ وَجَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ قُلْ سَمُّوهُمْ ۚ أَمْ تُنَبِّـُٔونَهُۥ بِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَم بِظَـٰهِرٍ مِّنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ ۗ بَلْ زُيِّنَ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مَكْرُهُمْ وَصُدُّوا۟ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ ۗ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنْ هَادٍ
rows.translation: Is He who sustains every soul in spite of what it earns [comparable to the idols]? Yet they ascribe partners to Allah! Say, ‘Name them!’ Will you inform Him concerning something He does not know about on the earth, or concerning [what are] mere words? Indeed, to the faithless, their scheming is presented as decorous, and they have been barred from the [right] way; and whomever Allah leads astray, has no guide.
rows.transliteration: afaman huwa qā-imun `alā kulli nafsin bimā kasabat ۗ waja`alū lillāhi shurakā-a qul sammūhum ۚ am tunabbi-ūnahu bimā lā ya`lamu fil-arḍi am biẓāhirin minal qawl ۗ bal zuyyina lilladhīna kafarū makruhum waṣuddū `anis sabīl ۗ wa man yuḍlilillāhu famā lahu min hād

rows.arabic: لَّهُمْ عَذَابٌ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَشَقُّ ۖ وَمَا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَاقٍ
rows.translation: There is a punishment for them in the life of this world, and the punishment of the Hereafter will surely be harder, and they have no defender against Allah.
rows.transliteration: lahum `adhābun fil ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati ashaqq ۖ wa mā lahum minallāhi min wāq

rows.arabic: مَّثَلُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلَّتِى وُعِدَ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ ۖ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ أُكُلُهَا دَآئِمٌ وَظِلُّهَا ۚ تِلْكَ عُقْبَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ ۖ وَّعُقْبَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ ٱلنَّارُ
rows.translation: A description of the paradise promised to the Godwary: streams run in it, its fruits and shade are everlasting. Such is the requital of those who are Godwary; and the requital of the faithless is the Fire.
rows.transliteration: mathalul jannatil latī wu`idal muttaqūn ۖ tajrī min taḥtihal-anhār ۖ ukuluhā dā-imun waẓilluhā ۚ tilka `uqbal ladhīnat-taqaw ۖ wa`uqbal kāfirīnan nār

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَفْرَحُونَ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمِنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ مَن يُنكِرُ بَعْضَهُۥ ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ ٱللَّهَ وَلَآ أُشْرِكَ بِهِۦٓ ۚ إِلَيْهِ أَدْعُوا۟ وَإِلَيْهِ مَـَٔابِ
rows.translation: Those whom We have given the Book rejoice in what has been sent down to you. Some of the factions deny a part of it. Say, ‘Indeed I have been commanded to worship Allah and not to ascribe any partner to Him. To Him do I summon [all mankind] and to Him will be my return.’
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna ātaynāhumul kitāba yafraḥūna bimā unzila ilayk ۖ wa minal-aḥzābi man yunkiru ba`ḍah ۚ qul innamā umirtu an a`budallāha walā ushrika bih ۚ ilayhi ad`ū wa ilayhi ma-āb

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًا عَرَبِيًّا ۚ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم بَعْدَ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا وَاقٍ
rows.translation: Thus We have sent it down as a dispensation in Arabic; and should you follow their desires after the knowledge that has come to you, you shall have against Allah neither any guardian nor defender.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika anzalnāhu ḥukman `arabiyyā ۚ wala-init-taba`ta ahwā-ahum ba`da mā jā-aka minal `il-mi mā laka minallāhi min waliyyin walā wāq

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلًا مِّن قَبْلِكَ وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً ۚ وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَن يَأْتِىَ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتَابٌ
rows.translation: Certainly We have sent apostles before you, and We appointed for them wives and descendants; and an apostle may not bring a sign except by Allah’s leave. There is a written [ordinance] for every term:
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā rusulan min qablika waja`alnā lahum azwājan wadhurriyyah ۚ wa mā kāna lirasūlin an ya-tiya bi-āyatin illā bi-idhnillāh ۗ likulli ajalin kitāb

rows.arabic: يَمْحُوا۟ ٱللَّهُ مَا يَشَآءُ وَيُثْبِتُ ۖ وَعِندَهُۥٓ أُمُّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ
rows.translation: Allah effaces and confirms whatever He wishes and with Him is the Mother Book.
rows.transliteration: yamḥullāhu mā yashā-u wayuthbit ۖ wa`indahu ummul kitāb

rows.arabic: وَإِن مَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ وَعَلَيْنَا ٱلْحِسَابُ
rows.translation: Whether We show you a part of what We promise them, or take you away [before that], your duty is only to communicate, and it is for Us to do the reckoning.
rows.transliteration: wa in mā nuriyannaka ba`ḍal ladhī na`iduhum aw natawaffayannaka fa-innamā `alaykal balāghu wa`alaynal ḥisāb

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا نَأْتِى ٱلْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ لَا مُعَقِّبَ لِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
rows.translation: Have they not seen how We visit the land diminishing it at its edges? Allah judges, and there is none who may repeal His judgement, and He is swift at reckoning.
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw annā na-til-arḍa nanquṣuhā min aṭrāfihā ۚ wallāhu yaḥkumu lā mu`aqqiba liḥukmih ۚ wahuwa sarī`ul ḥisāb

rows.arabic: وَقَدْ مَكَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَكْرُ جَمِيعًا ۖ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْسِبُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلْكُفَّـٰرُ لِمَنْ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
rows.translation: Those who were before them [also] schemed; yet all devising belongs to Allah. He knows what every soul earns. Soon the faithless will know in whose favour the outcome of that abode will be.
rows.transliteration: waqad makaral ladhīna min qablihim falillāhil makru jamī`ā ۖ ya`lamu mā taksibu kullu nafs ۗ wasaya`lamul kuffāru liman `uqbad dār

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَسْتَ مُرْسَلًا ۚ قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدًۢا بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكُمْ وَمَنْ عِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ
rows.translation: The faithless say, ‘You have not been sent [by Allah].’ Say, ‘Allah suffices as a witness between me and you, and he who possesses the knowledge of the Book.’
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lasta mursalā ۚ qul kafā billāhi shahīdan baynī wabaynakum wa man `indahu `il-mul kitāb
